alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clark; Dallas; Ouachita (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Clark, northeastern Calhoun, southern Dallas and northeastern Ouachita Counties through 415 AM CDT... At 314 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Richwoods, or 11 miles southeast of Arkadelphia, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fordyce... Bearden... Sparkman... Thornton... Ellisville... Harlow... Chambersville... Princeton... Manning... Ouachita... Holly Springs... Vaden... Hopeville... Pine Grove... Ivan... Dalark... Griffithtown... Ramsey... Millville... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for southeastern and southwestern Arkansas.
